channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syrian Jews return to Damascus for the first time in decades, hoping to build bridges
item.description: Thousands of Jews left Syria in 1992, when they were allowed to emigrate. The visit by a small delegation of U.S.-based Syrian Jewish religious figure...

item.title: Thailand deports dozens of Uyghurs to China, activists say
item.description: The detainees were part of a group of some 300 Uyghurs who fled China and were arrested in Thailand in 2014. Thailand deported more than 100 of them t...

item.title: Tate brothers allowed to leave Romania for US
item.description: The influencers had been banned from travelling out of Romania for more than two years.

item.title: North Korea has sent more troops to Russia, South's spy agency says
item.description: The reports of a new deployment come after Pyongyang was said to be suffering heavy losses in the Kursk region.

item.title: Israel confirms Hamas handed over hostages' bodies as Palestinian prisoners released
item.description: It was the last exchange of the Gaza ceasefire deal's first phase, leaving questions over what happens next.

item.title: How Trump's crackdown plays into misperceptions about immigrants and crime
item.description: The White House portrays its immigration crackdown as a success. Critics say the administration is trying to look tough for the cameras, and worry abo...

item.title: Why are the Tate brothers heading to the US?
item.description: Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan have left Romania, where they were previously under a travel ban.

item.title: Trump administration cuts most USAID programs. And, the ethics of leaving your job
item.description: Nearly all USAID programs have been eliminated. One official says it's a "global health massacre." And, a federal judge will hear arguments over the d...

item.title: Republican Sen. Josh Hawley discusses his mission to hold big tech accountable
item.description: Republican Senator Josh Hawley of Missouri talks about his mission to hold tech companies accountable even as they try to align themselves with Presid...

item.title: Gene Hackman and his wife Betsy Arakawa found dead at their home
item.description: Local police said they didn't believe any foul play was involved in the death of the couple, found alongside their dog.
